title: (x) West Wind - Hellenic Wide {Mark S}
content:

 [‹ (x) Art & Walls - Castellar {Yves}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080503185007/http:/www.typophile.com/node/6880 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Mormon Missionary Nametag - engraved lettering {Raph} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080503185007/http:/www.typophile.com/node/6861 "Go to next forum topic")
author: anonymous

comments.content:
It's not an exact match,   
   
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/baselinefonts/58-rodeo/regular/testdrive.html?s=WEST+WIND&p=48](http://web.archive.org/web/20080503185007/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/baselinefonts/58-rodeo/regular/testdrive.html?s=WEST+WIND&p=48)   
   
 I keep searching.

[Zapata](http://web.archive.org/web/20080503185007/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontfont/ff-zapata/?PREFS_SET%5BRenderSize%5D=48&PREFS_SET%5BRenderString%5D=WEST+WIND)   
Edit: Not an exact match either...   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080503185007im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/sad.gif)
The original name of this font is Helenic Wide. It was an old metal foundry face. I don't know of any digitizations under that name. Looks like it was the source for Hefty.
Varityper did a version of Hellenic Wide, but I don't know if it's available any more. We had it at an old print shop I worked at that had migrated from a Varityper composer to the Mac.
